page.title: 19Harbourside Activities.
page.content: The{Sealink Ferries}are used for taking{goods,cars,lorries and {passengers}out to{Cherbourg}and the {Channel Islands.}People often go to Cherbourg for the day or go on a "Night Flyer"to the Channel Islands. The{harbour}has a{5p ferry,a little {rowing boat}that goes from the{Quay {side across to the Nothe Gardens.}Lots of people go across on it because it saves a{long walk over Town Bridge. Often{crabs caught off Portland}can be seen being{unloaded by the Quay. Some people go{fishing off Stone Pier. There are fish like Mackerel and Whiting to be caught. { Weymouth}has been used as a{Port since{Roman times.}Today{yachts from {many countries}can be seen{moored along side the Quay.Sometimes{gravel is{loaded onto ships}on the Nothe side of the Harbour.-Lorraine Sparks.
